jade.core
Class Actor

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Messenger
      jade.core.Actor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public abstract class Actor
extends Messenger
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents any that could be placed on a jade world. Using the act method, the actor can perform its specified action. Actors can also be attached to other actors, so they move as one. Actors can also be expired, meaning that they should be ignored by all actors and discarded as soon as possible.

See Also:

Method Detail

act

public abstract void act()
Specifies the actors behavior. This method is intended to be called by the world's tick method call the act method on all actors who should have a turn.

setPos

public void setPos(int x,
                   int y)
Moves the actor to the specified location on the actor's world. The actor must belong to a world, and should not be attached to another actor.

Parameters:
x - the new x location
y - the new y location

move

public void move(int dx,
                 int dy)
Moves uses setPos to move the actor by the specified amount. The actor must belong to a world, and should not be attached to another actor.

Parameters:
dx - the amount to move horizontally
dy - the amount to move vertically

x

public int x()
Returns the x-coordinate of the actor. The actor must belong to a world. If it is attached to another actor, this will be the x-coordinate of the actor's holder.

Returns:
the x-coordinate of the actor

y

public int y()
Returns the y-coordinate of the actor. The actor must belong to a world. If it is attached to another actor, this will be the y-coordinate of the actor's holder.

Returns:
the y-coordinate of the actor

holds

public java.util.Collection<Actor> holds()
Returns a collection of the actors this actor holds. The collection returned is not the actual backing collection, so any changes made to this collection will not be reflected in the actor.

Returns:
a collection of the actors this actor holds.

attachTo

public void attachTo(Actor actor)
Attaches this actor to another. The actor should not be held by another. If the actor belongs to a world, it will be removed and placed on the new holder's world. This actors position will then be the holder's position.

Parameters:
actor -

detachFrom

public void detachFrom()
Detaches this actor from its holder. The actor must be held. The actor will be placed on the holder's world at the holder's position (assuming the holder belongs to a world).

held

public boolean held()
Returns true if the actor is held.

Returns:
true if the actor is held.

holder

public Actor holder()
Returns the actor if the actor is held, or null if it is not.

Returns:
the actor if the actor is held, or null if it is not.

bound

public boolean bound()
Returns true if the actor belongs to a world.

Returns:
true if the actor belongs to a world.

boundTo

public boolean boundTo(World world)
Checks whether the actor belongs to the given world.

Parameters:
world - the world to be checked
Returns:
true if the actor belongs to the world, false otherwise

isExpired

public boolean isExpired()
Returns true if the actor is expired.

Returns:
true if the actor is expired.

expire

public void expire()
Expires this actor. This will also expire all actors attached to this actor.

look

public ColoredChar look()
Returns the appearance of this actor.

Returns:
the appearance of this actor.

world

public World world()
Returns the world the actor currently belongs too, or null if it does not belong to a world.

Returns:
the world the actor currently belongs too, or null if it does not belong to a world.
